info.description:
The Versal Partner API enables organizations to manage users, courses, and performance metrics from applications built on top of the Versal Platform.
# Concepts
## API Keys
API keys grant broad access to organization data on Versal. Among other operations, they can be used to:
- create and modify organization users
- create sessions for organization users
- retrieve organizational courses
- retrieve learner metrics

If your existing organization has not received an API key, please [contact Versal support](https://support.versal.com) and we will issue one. If you have not yet registered with Versal, [sign up for a free trial](https://versal.com/trial/business) to receive your API key.
## User Sessions
User sessions grant a single user restricted access to organization resources. They can be used to retrieve, launch, and consume content using the Versal Course Player.
## User Roles
Users are assigned a role within your organization.

  | Role        | Description           | 
  | ------------- |---------------| 
  | admin|  Admins have full control over all of the resources within the organization. They can add and remove users from the organization, manage user roles, edit and manage courses, and view course analytics.
  | instructor|  Instructors can view any course shared with the organization, create and manage their own courses, invite learners to courses, and view course analytics.
  | learner|  Learners can enroll in any course shared with the organization.


## Versal Course Player
The Versal Course Player is a browser-based runtime for Versal course content. An overview of its usage and API is available [here](https://support.versal.com/hc/en-us/articles/203271866-Embedding-organizational-courses).
# Topics
## Requests
All requests and responses reference the Versal Partner API available at: https://stack.versal.com/api2. Requests must be made over HTTPS; requests over standard HTTP will be redirected to the corresponding HTTPS endpoint.
## Authentication
All requests to the Versal API must include an SID header with a valid API key or user session ID. If your organization has not received an API key, please please [contact Versal support](https://support.versal.com) and we will issue one.

``` curl -H 'SID: YOUR_API_KEY' https://stack.versal.com/api2/courses/123  ```
## Pagination
All responses for collections of resources return a subset of the collection and an X-Pagination header describing the total volume of resources available. The body of the header is a JSON object containing pagination information:

``` X-Pagination: {"count":3737,"page":1,"nextPage":2,"perPage":20,"pageCount":187} ```

Subsequent pages from the collection endpoint may be retrieved by setting the page query parameter:
``` curl https://stack.versal.com/api2/courses/123/userdata?page=2 -H 'SID: YOUR_API_KEY' ```

tags.name: Sessions
tags.description: Create learner API sessions to view and interact with content in your organization

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Create and manage learners in your organization

tags.name: Courses
tags.description: Course content including metadata, lessons, and gadgets

tags.description: Track and view progress for course learners

tags.name: Gadget Configurations
tags.description: Gadget configurations include all user-defined metadata (e.g. the title and questions of a survey) attached to a particular gadget.

tags.name: Gadget User Data
tags.description: Gadget user data requests return the interactions of all users with a particular gadget (e.g. user responses to a survey)

post.summary: Add a new user API session
post.description: User sessions include the SID needed to launch the Versal Course Player. User sessions have a 30-day lifetime. The session lifetime is refreshed with every use.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API key

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Indicates the session owner user

post.summary: Add a new user to your organization with a role
post.description: Add a new user to your organization with a role

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API key

get.summary: Retrieve the user associated with this SID
get.description: Retrieve the user associated with this SID

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: The session ID for the user of interest

put.description: Both API keys and user session IDs may be used to modify existing users. Note that the PUT verb in this instances behaves as a PATCH: attributes omitted in an update request will simply be ignored by the server.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API integration key or session belonging to the user of interest

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Numeric user ID

put.summary: Update a user's role in your organization
put.description: Change or remove a user's role within your organization

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API integration key

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Your numeric organization ID

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: The numeric user ID

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Describes user's updated role

get.description:
The organization member listing displays users in your organization and their assigned role. Users that are part of the organization but have not been assigned a role are shown with an empty roles:[] record. 
Returns a paginated result set.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API integration key

parameters.name: orgId
parameters.description: Your numeric organization ID

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: View page of a paginated result set

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Set page size of a paginated result set

count.description: The total number of items available in the requested collection

pageCount.description: The number of pages available with the current perPage value

perPage.description: The requested number of items per page

get.description:
Lists courses available to the calling session. 
Published course revisions are returned when the calling session does not have edit rights for the course. In-edit (sandbox) course revisions are returned when the calling session has edit rights for the course.
Returns a paginated result set.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API integration key or user session ID

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: Filter for courses with title containing this string (case insensitive)

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Filter for courses where the given user ID has permission to edit and/or publish the course

parameters.name: catalog
parameters.description: Filter for courses that are published ("labs") or unpublished ("sandbox")

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: View page of a paginated result set

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Set page size of a paginated result set

count.description: The total number of items available in the requested collection

pageCount.description: The number of pages available with the current perPage value

perPage.description: The requested number of items per page

get.summary: Retrieve content and metadata of a course
get.description:
Deep course requests (?depth=full) retrieve the complete content of a course. These requests expose the lesson and gadget IDs required by subsequent requests.
The published course revision is returned when the calling session does not have edit rights for the course. The in-edit (sandbox) course revision is returned when the calling session has edit rights for the course. To request the published course revision with a privileged session, use "GET /catalogs/staged/courses/{courseId}"

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API integration key or user session ID

parameters.name: depth
parameters.description: Depth "full" returns all course lessons and gadgets. Depth "lessons" returns course lessons only and omits the lesson.gadget[] arrays.

get.summary: Request the published revision of the given Course. See "GET /courses/{courseId}"

patch.summary: Mark a learner as tracked for a course
patch.description: Tracking a user within a course will include that learner's progress in subsequent course progress reports.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API integration key

parameters.name: courseId
parameters.description: Course where learner's progress will be tracked

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: Learner's user ID

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Toggles learner tracking for the user

get.summary: Retrieve learner progress summaries for a course
get.description:
Learner progress requests retrieve a summary of the progress of all users enrolled in a specific course.
Returns a paginated result set.

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API integration key

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: View page of a paginated result set

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Set page size of a paginated result set

parameters.name: userIds
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of user IDs. Results will be filtered to users in this list.

count.description: The total number of items available in the requested collection

pageCount.description: The number of pages available with the current perPage value

perPage.description: The requested number of items per page

get.summary: Retrieve the configuration for a single gadget
get.description:
Gadget configurations include all user-defined metadata (e.g. the title and questions of a survey) attached to a particular gadget. Schema varies by gadget type.
When the calling session belongs to any client with edit permissions on the parent course, the in-edit (sandbox) version of the gadget configuration is returned. When the calling session belongs to a client without edit permissions on the course, the published version of the gadget configuration is returned. 
When the calling session belongs to a user with edit permissions on the parent course, the response will include the gadget's private fields (e.g., the answer key for a quiz gadget). For all other calling session types, gadget private fields will be redacted from the response.

parameters.name: courseId
parameters.description: ID for the course containing the gadget

parameters.name: gadgetId
parameters.description: Gadget ID

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API integration key or user session

get.summary: Retrieve the published version of the configuration for a single gadget

parameters.name: courseId
parameters.description: ID for the parent course

parameters.name: gadgetId
parameters.description: Gadget ID

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API integration key or user session

get.summary: Retrieve user data for a single gadget
get.description:
Gadget user data requests return the interactions of all users with a particular gadget (e.g. user responses to a quiz).
Returns a paginated result set.

parameters.name: courseId
parameters.description: ID for the parent course

parameters.name: lessonId
parameters.description: ID for the parent lesson

parameters.name: gadgetId
parameters.description: Gadget ID

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: View page of a paginated result set

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Set page size of a paginated result set

parameters.name: SID
parameters.description: API integration key or user session

catalogs.description: Contains 'labs' if the course has been published

coverImage.description: Course cover image metadata. Omitted if the course does not have a cover image.

public.description: Indicates whether the course is publicly available

longDesc.description: A paragraph statement describing the course. Omitted if not defined.

shortDesc.description: A summary statement of the course. Omitted if not defined.

tags.description: A list of user-defined tags indicating course metadata

title.description: Course title. Omitted if not defined.

users.description: Lists users with rights to edit and/or publish the course

catalogs.description: Contains 'labs' if the course has been published

coverImage.description: Course cover image metadata. Omitted if the course does not have a cover image.

public.description: Indicates whether the course is publicly available

longDesc.description: A paragraph statement describing the course. Omitted if not defined.

shortDesc.description: A summary statement of the course. Omitted if not defined.

tags.description: A list of user-defined tags indicating course metadata

title.description: Course title. Omitted if not defined.

users.description: Lists users with rights to edit and/or publish the course

lastPublished.description: Date of most recent course publication

id.description: Gadget identifier. Unique within a course.

completeDate.description: Date learner completed the course. Omitted if learner has not completed the course.

lastActivity.description: Date learner last visited the course

email.description: Learner's email address. Omitted if not available.

courseCompleted.description: Indicates whether learner has completed the course

firstname.description: Learner's given name. Omitted if not available.

lastname.description: Learner's family name. Omitted if not available.

fullname.description: Learner's full name. Omitted if not available.

id.description: Lesson identifier. Unique within a course.

userId.description: Required if email is not given

email.description: Required if userId is not given

shortDesc.description: A brief statement about the user
A brief statement about the user

displayname.description: A calculated display name based on available non-null name fields

shortDesc.description: A brief statement about the user
